intro: Hippocrepis balearica var. minoricensis, commonly known as the Minorica rock-rose, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Balearic Islands. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant thrives in rocky and limestone soils, often growing in coastal or inland cliffs. It is adapted to the Mediterranean climate, featuring drought-resistant properties and a compact growth form. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
